Description: Wall sherd (mended from four fragments and plaster) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown, four bands of white-red-white stripes; tondo reserved with zig-zag around periphery; exterior, cream slip: above, two animal friezes; on top, in black-figure, part of a panther with raised paw attacking a bull to left; below, grazing wild goats to left; on lower wall, lotus flower and bud chain; and ray around base; dividing bands of stopt meander running left between bands separate the decorative fields; white dots on body of panther; filling ornaments: pendant roundels, quatrefoils, dotted rosettes, swastikas.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.243, no.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.190)
